column4: hey im new to uuntu ive downloaded firefox aurora and cant figure out how to open the download from firefox download screen
hello mr potatohead
Did you download a debian/ubuntu version of aurora?

In order to use it you need to extract it.  When you download it from their site they give you a tar.bz2 file.  You can either double click on that an your GUI will probably extract it for you, leaving you with an executable, or you can extract it on the command line.
If extracting a downloaded file, or using the command line, is outside your realm of knowledge, do you think it's a good idea to run alpha/beta software?  Not trying to be a jerk, just saying.
Thats one way to get help.
Do you know which *buntu and which GUI you are running?
Drop the attitude.  Were here to help.  You need to remember that most of us are actually sitting at jobs right now WHILE trying to help you.
Did you not read what the good bot told you earlier?
Seriously?
You've been given help.  Other than driving to your house and opening it for you what more would you like?
Read the help!  It tells you EXACTLY WHAT TO CLICK.
click the Ubuntu logo and start typing terminal.
Do you know where you downloaded the firefox file?
Yes, but where did you save it to?
Try running "ls", do you see a Downloads listed?
Then type "cd downloads"
You have to match the case.  So if it's Downloads you need to do "cd Downloads"
Try running "ls -l"
Yes, in the terminal type in "ls -l" without the quotes.
You sure you downloaded it?  :)
